Weightlifting as a Vegetarian.Can vegetarians build muscle as effectiv: Yes, muscle growth depends on progressive resistance training and sufficient protein intake. If you stick to a diet with enough protein and balance and a progressive overload training plan, vegetarians can also gain strength/build muscle as effectively as meat-eaters.
Weightlifting as a Vegetarian.What are good protein sources for vegeta: Legumes, tofu, tempeh, seitan, quinoa, eggs, greek yogurt, cottage cheese, nutritional yeast, gluten flour, and more.
Weightlifting as a Vegetarian.How much protein do I really need?: Aim for 0.7-1.0 gram of protein per pound of body weight per day. For a 150lb lifter, that would be 105-150g of protein spread throughout the day.
Weightlifting as a Vegetarian.What is a complete protein?: A food is a complete protein when it contains all nine of the essential amino acids necessary in human diet. This includes eggs, dairy, soy products, quinoa, buckwheat, and hemp. Some common vegetarian incomplete protein sources include nuts and seeds, whole grains, vegetables, and legumes. However, as long as you eat a variety of complete + incomplete proteins, your body will be able to form complete proteins. For example, beans and grains can be paired to make a complete protein.
Weightlifting as a Vegetarian.Do I need to use protein powder as a veg: It is not strictly necessary to use protein powder on your weightlifting journey as a vegetarian as long as you prioritize protein in your diet. Otherwise, it is perfectly good to help boost your protein intake with protein powder, especially on days when you have less time to cook protein heavy meals.
Weightlifting as a Vegetarian.Can I get enough iron on a vegetarian di: Though plant iron is absorbed less efficiently than meat based iron, you can definitely get enough iron on a vegetarian diet through lentils, spinach, beans. Try pairing these foods with vitamin C rich foods like bell peppers or citrus to boost the iron's absorption.
Weightlifting as a Vegetarian.Should I use creatine? Is it vegetarian-: Yes! Most creatine powders are synthetic. Creatine improves strength, power/energy, muscle growth, and has even been linked to improved cognitive function. It's been studied to be especially helpful in vegetarian diets, as vegetarians do not get creatine from their diet naturally, unlike meat-eaters.
Weightlifting as a Vegetarian.Do soy products affect hormone levels?: There are some beliefs that eating soy products affects hormones, but a moderate intake of soy is safe and studies do show that soy protein does not reduce testosterone or worsen strength gains.
Weightlifting as a Vegetarian.What are some good high-calorie vegetari: Nuts, seeds, avocado, olive oil, whole grains, and full-fat dairy like yogurt and cheese are great high-calorie foods for bulking!
Weightlifting as a Vegetarian.What's the biggest tip for vegetarian li: Tracking nutrition at first to make sure you're eating enough protein and calories to grow stronger is really helpful. It can be harder for vegetarians to get enough protein on a daily basis compared to meat-eaters, so it helps a lot, especially in the beginning, to track your protein intake.

Pop Mart.What is Pop Mart?: Pop Mart is a company that creates and sells collectible 'art toys'.
Pop Mart.What is a 'blind box'?: A blind box contains a random collectible figure from a specific series. You don't know which one you've gotten until you open it.
Pop Mart.Who designs all these different characte: Each series is created by a different artist or design studio. Pop Mart collaborates with artists to bring their unique visions to life as art toys.
Pop Mart.What are 'secret' figures?: A 'secret' is a rare, hard-to-find figure hidden in a small percentage of blind boxes in a series. Finding one is considered very lucky!
Pop Mart.Where can I buy Pop Mart figures?: They are sold in Pop Mart retail stores, online, and through vending machines.
Pop Mart.How much does a typical blind box cost?: In the US, prices usually range from $11 to $15 per box, depending on the series.
Pop Mart.I see Labubu everywhere. Why is that cha: The Monsters series, featuring Labubu, was created by artist Kasing Lung. The character has a unique design: a mischievous monster with rabbit ears.
Pop Mart.What's your favorite character?: It's definitely Dimoo! I love his big eyes, cloud-like hair, and the dreamy, adventurous world he explores in his series.
Pop Mart.Is it better to buy single boxes or a wh: It depends! Singles are great for the thrill of the surprise. A case (usually 12 boxes) is better if you want to get every standard figure in a series.
Pop Mart.Can you trade figures?: Yes, there is a large and active community of collectors who buy, sell, and trade figures to complete their collections.

Coffee.What is the difference between Arabica a: Arabica beans tend to have a sweeter, softer taste, with tones of sugar, fruit, and berries. Robusta, however, has a stronger, harsher taste, with a grain-like overtone and peanutty aftertaste.
Coffee.How does caffeine affect the body?: Caffeine is a stimulant that acts on the central nervous system, increasing alertness and reducing fatigue.
Coffee.What is the best way to store coffee bea: Store them in an airtight container at room temperature, away from heat, light, and moisture.
Coffee.What is the ideal water temperature for: The ideal water temperature for brewing coffee is between 195°F and 205°F (90°C and 96°C).
Coffee.What is the difference between a latte a: A cappuccino has a more even distribution of espresso, steamed milk, and foamed milk, while a latte has much more steamed milk and a light layer of foam.
Coffee.How is decaf coffee made?: The most common methods involve using solvents, water, or carbon dioxide to extract caffeine from the beans.
Coffee.What is 'single-origin' coffee?: Single-origin coffee is coffee grown within a single known geographic origin, such as a single farm or a specific collection of beans from a single country.
Coffee.What is the history of coffee?: Coffee was first discovered in Ethiopia in the 11th century. It then spread to the Middle East and eventually to Europe and the Americas.
Coffee.What are the health benefits of drinking: Coffee is a good source of antioxidants and has been linked to a reduced risk of several diseases, including Parkinson's, type 2 diabetes, and liver disease.
Coffee.What is the environmental impact of coff: Coffee production can have a significant environmental impact, including deforestation and water pollution. However, sustainable and shade-grown coffee practices can help to mitigate these effects.

Ergonomic Keyboards.What is an ergonomic keyboard?: A keyboard designed to reduce strain and improve comfort while typing. There are different improvements, such as split, tenting, cushioning, and ortholinear layouts.
Ergonomic Keyboards.Why do I use an ergonomic keyboard?: I had a weird typing habit that made me press the space key with my index finger instead of my thumb. This over time caused discomfort and strain, leading me to seek a chance to relearn my typing technique. A ergonomic keyboard helps me with this process.
Ergonomic Keyboards.What is my daily driver?: My daily driver is a ZSA Moonlander MK1, which features a split, tenting, and ortholinear design with thumb clusters.
Ergonomic Keyboards.What is my favorite keyboard layout?: I use Colemak DH as my daily driver, and only switch to QWERTY when gaming. This is because the most commonly used letters in English are all concentrated in the home row.
Ergonomic Keyboards.Why are split keyboards popular?: They allow for a more natural hand position, reducing wrist strain.
Ergonomic Keyboards.What is tenting?: Tenting refers to raising the middle of the keyboard, which helps keep wrists in a more neutral position.
Ergonomic Keyboards.What is an ortholinear layout?: An ortholinear layout arranges keys in a grid pattern, which can minimize wrist movement and increase typing efficiency.
Ergonomic Keyboards.Why are some ergonomic keyboards curved?: Curved keyboards are designed to match the natural shape of the hands, promoting a more comfortable typing posture.
Ergonomic Keyboards.What is my end game ergonomic keyboard?: I will either go full minimal with a Corne, or full ergonomic with a custom 3D printed Dactyl Manuform.
Ergonomic Keyboards.How do you know if an ergonomic keyboard: Sometimes you just have to fully dive into something to understand whether it is good for you. The learning curve may be steep, but the potential benefits for your comfort and health can be worth it.

My favorite Cars.What is my fictional dream car?: There is a car called Beck Kustoms F132 in a video game called "Need for Speed", and its combination of futuristic F1 car and hot rod is just perfect. Someone made a real-life version of it, but it just feels different from in-game.
My favorite Cars.What is my non-fictional unrealistic dre: As of now, I believe Rauh-Welt Begriff (RWB) Porsche 911 with the widebody kit is on the top. It is unrealistic not just because of it's cost, but because of its rarity: it is basically hand-built by one person!
My favorite Cars.What is my realistic dream car?: Currently, I am waiting for the Toyota Supra MK6 to be released, as it promises to be a perfect blend of performance and style. Supras are known to be reliable and not too expensive as a sports car.
My favorite Cars.Is hybrid better than electric?: Yes. Now that the carpool lane advantage is gone, hybrids offer better overall reliability, efficiency, and range.
My favorite Cars.Under what conditions will I get an elec: Only when solid-state batteries become mainstream and affordable, and the charging infrastructure is significantly improved.
My favorite Cars.What car do I currently drive?: I drive a Toyota RAV4 2017, and it is the most comfortable and reliable car I have ever driven.
My favorite Cars.Will I ever own a motorcycle?: No, but I would like to try riding one someday.
My favorite Cars.How did I get into this hobby to begin w: I played with small model cars as child, and racing them on hotrod tracks sparked my interest.
My favorite Cars.What are other notable mentions?: My favorite car used to be the newer Audi R8, but have changed after it's discontinuation.

Japan in my eyes.What is Japan for me?: Japan is a magical place that holds a special significance for me. As a Japanese person who lived in China, I used to visit Japan every summer during my break. These trips allowed me to experience the beautiful and fun aspects of the country. Additionally, I once traveled to Japan alone for a month, which was a transformative experience that helped me find myself.
Japan in my eyes.What are some myths about Japan?: Japanese people are nice, but also very reserved. Usually if you don't strike up a conversation yourself, they will be either indifferent or polite.
Japan in my eyes.Why is Japan my most recommended solo-tr: Japan is very safe, clean, and has literally endless places to explore. On their way, people will also feel the right amount of loneliness from the remote environment, which is, in my opinion, a perfect place for them to know more about themselves rather than others.
Japan in my eyes.What is my recommended hidden gem stone: There are tons of hidden and remote places that travelers will remember for the rest of their lives, but the one for me is Rokko mountain in Kobe, Hyogo prefecture. When I solo traveled there, there was only one hostel there, no public transportation except a gondola lift that carries people on and off the mountain. It is developed enough for you to be able to walk on paved roads, but still feels remote and untouched.
Japan in my eyes.What is my recommendation for anybody wh: With the current state of tourism in Japan, I would suggest planning a trip to a not-so-popular prefecture would be the best option. Personally, I prefer to explore the lesser-known areas, as they often offer a more authentic experience of Japanese culture and lifestyle.
Japan in my eyes.What is the best season to go to Japan?: Spring, because cherry blossoms are in full bloom around late March to early April, and the temperature is the best around then.
Japan in my eyes.What is my favorite Japanese food?: Ramen. There are so many different styles and flavors to try, and each region has its own unique take on this beloved dish.
Japan in my eyes.What is my favorite Japanese city?: Kyoto. It is a city that perfectly blends traditional and modern elements, with its stunning temples, beautiful gardens, and vibrant culture. I would always recommend people to book an Airbnb next to a popular shrine (such as Fushimi Inari Taisha), and visit them at night to avoid the tourism rush.
Japan in my eyes.What is my favorite Japanese tradition?: Kimodameshi (a test of courage) is a traditional activity in which participants spend a night in a haunted location. It is often done in groups and involves various challenges to confront fears. It definitely feels different when there are so many stories about yurei (ghosts) and yokai (supernatural creatures).
Japan in my eyes.What is my favorite anime?: Natsume Book of Friends. I watched it as a kid together with my sister, and it perfectly captures the beauty of life, its imperfections, and time.

Board games.What are my favorite games?: I prefer high interaction strategy games - my current favorite is Dune Imperium, but I love playing a round of Sidereal Confluence when enough people are interested
Board games.What games am I learning?: I'm picking up Twilight Struggle, a two-player cold war era wargame (think a more complicated and less dice roll focused version of risk), and Pax Renaissance, a renaissance era game about trade, religion, and prestige
Board games.What about Catan, Monopoly, etc.?: While I enjoy these games, I find modern board games to be more skill expressive and have more intereseting decision spaces
Board games.What game should I play to explore more: Of the ones I've played, I would recommend Irish Gauge (a train game) and Race for the Galaxy (an iconic card space-age card game)
Board games.Are there games you can play solo?: Yes, but I prefer to compete with others. Many games have an 'AI' player in the form of a random decision deck.
Board games.What do you do if you have too many play: Some lower stakes games that are more inclusive: liars dice and wizard!
Board games.Modern board games are way more expensiv: Yes, popular modern board games can be anywhere from 40-100 USD. People are collectors though, so buying used is the way to go! I've gotten some of my favorite games for 80-20% off.
Board games.What games am I looking to get next?: I would love terraforming mars and gaia project, but I have enough for now.
Board games.It's just me and one other person, what: An easy 2-player designed game I like is 7 Wonders Duel. It's a quick 20 minute card drafting game that has an interesting decision space without being overly complicated. I've played with my parents!
Board games.Where can I buy games?: For new - your best bet is probably Amazon as many of the games come from obscure publishers. Some of the more popular (but still not super mainstream) games will be at Barnes and Noble. For a more comprehensive collection, look for a board game store near you! However, I strongly recommend looking on Facebook marketplace. You can get a good idea of the games to buy from reddit.

Gaming & Interactive Media: Video Game D.What genres do you enjoy most?: Action RPGs, 3D platformers, flight and racing sims, factory games, and MOBAs.
Gaming & Interactive Media: Video Game D.Favorite games or series?: League of Legends, Mario Odyssey, Arkham City, and Factorio
Gaming & Interactive Media: Video Game D.How do you choose what to play?: I prioritize strong design, replayability, and a compelling gameplay loop. I enjoy games that I can pick up easily after a long break.
Gaming & Interactive Media: Video Game D.Do you play competitively?: Casually. I enjoy ranked ladders for learning and improvement, but I primarily value good sportsmanship and consistent practice.
Gaming & Interactive Media: Video Game D.What platforms do you use?: PC and Nintendo Switch primarily. I also play on my phone.
Gaming & Interactive Media: Video Game D.What games are you looking forward to?: Hopefully, Nintendo announces a new Mario 3D platformer!
Gaming & Interactive Media: Video Game D.How do games influence your software wor: They sharpen my sense for user feedback loops, performance optimization, and systems thinking—useful for building responsive UIs and scalable backends.
Gaming & Interactive Media: Video Game D.How do you manage screen time?: Time-boxed sessions, prioritizing fitness and sleep, and playing socially when possible to keep the hobby balanced and healthy.

Full-Stack Web Development: React, Node.js, Python, and modern JavaScript frameworks
Machine Learning: TensorFlow, PyTorch, and data science applications
